comments:
I am just starting to experiment with CVS on Eclipse.

I tried "Synchronize with Repository" and get NPEs in the log.

This must be a setup issue ( CVSNT and repository are setup) but I do not get
any helpful message from Eclipse as to what is missing. 

Instead an NPE is quietly delivered into the Error Log and all CVS actions on
the menu remain enabled i.e. available. 

In JBuilder if something is not setup the corresponding actions stay disabled
till the setup is fixed.

This is what I get :
------------------------------------------------------------------------

Should users get an helpful message ?

When I started Eclipse all CVS actions were enabled. Now after the error I went
into window preferences, browsed the CVS options , exited without saving, went
back to CVS menu and all actions are disabled !!!

So it has worked out something now. Not sure what though.

This doesn't look like a setup issue. Did you use CVS>Synchronize from the 
main menu or Team>Synchronize from a context menu?

This is due to an initialization problem in the CVS main menu. We have another
bug that is related to this but I couldn't find it.
Bogdan, please verify during 3.2 M3 test pass
